articles.title: Pakistan closes pedestrian traffic at all Iran border crossings as Israel strikes escalate
articles.description: QUETTA: Pakistani authorities have closed all major border crossings with Iran for pedestrian traffic amid escalating cross-border strikes between Iran and Israel, officials in the southwestern Balochistan province said on Sunday. The closures affect the Taftan crossing in Chaghi district, the Gabd-Rimdan crossing in Gwadar district, the Chedgi and Jirrak crossings in Panjgur

articles.description: Emergency services have swarmed the small town of North Motton…
articles.content:
A Tasmanian police officer has died following a shooting at a rural property near Ulverstone today.
The officer was carrying out “routine duties” at a property on Allison Road at North Motton when the fatal shooting occurred around 11am.

articles.title: Scientists reveal the hidden trigger behind massive floods
articles.description: Atmospheric rivers, while vital for replenishing water on the U.S. West Coast, are also the leading cause of floods though storm size alone doesn t dictate their danger. A groundbreaking study analyzing over 43,000 storms across four decades found that pre-existing soil moisture is a critical factor, with flood peaks multiplying when the ground is already saturated.
articles.content: Atmospheric rivers are responsible for most flooding on the West Coast of the U.S., but also bring much needed moisture to the region. The size of these storms doesn't always translate to flood risk, however, as other factors on the ground play impor... [4843 chars]

articles.title: Iloilo records surge in dengue cases
articles.description: Based on the data from Iloilo Provincial Health Office (IPHO), the number of dengue cases increased to 1,742 from January 1 to May 17, 2025.
articles.content:
ILOILO CITY — Dengue cases in Iloilo rose by 77 percent in over five months.
